div.p:
You will never get rid of my
persecutions about Mdm. Carmichael and
her manuscripts until you oblige me
by doing what I ask - and I will be as
reasonable as an unreasonable woman
can be.

You have a manuscript of hers
which you declined publishing but which
you were so kind to offer to dispose of for
her to Longman & Co or some other publisher
- She wished to have it back again first to re-
modelremodel - But I write to advise her against
this, if you can dispose of it for her - And
I pray you to try - Dispose of it for whatever
you can get for and let me know the result
- If you find that the publisher requires to
have any part altered or the whole remodelled
let me know and it will be time enough
then to send it back & set the poor lady
to the remodelling labor -

I shall expect to have your answer
next week my dear Sir -

And at the same time I wish you
would tell me what you have determined
about the history of the Bible stories which she sent you -
a work for young people - 1st plainly - do you
intend to publish it? - 2ly. When? - 3ly What
do you mean to give her for it?

You have also a tale written by
Miss Carmichael - pray tell me your decision
respecting that also -

Mm. Carmichael has waited months
for your answers - She is a most patient person -
I am No most impatient - and believe
me you shall be worried weekly with letters
untill you answer me -

I know your good nature and will
prey upon it -
div.closer:
I am Dr. Sir
Yours sincerely
Maria Edgeworth

postscript.p:
Please to direct to me under cover
to Lieutt. Coll Yorke
Dublin Castle
